# canBecomeKey

**Instance Property**

A Boolean value that indicates whether the window can become the key window.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor var canBecomeKey: Bool { get }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the window can become the key window, otherwise, [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].

Attempts to make the window the key window are abandoned if the value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false]. The value of this property is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] if the window has a title bar or a resize bar, or [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false] otherwise.

## Managing Key Status

- **isKeyWindow**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the window is the key window for the application.
- **makeKey()**: Makes the window the key window.
- **makeKeyAndOrderFront(_:)**: Moves the window to the front of the screen list, within its level, and makes it the key window; that is, it shows the window.
- **becomeKey()**: Informs the window that it has become the key window.
- **resignKey()**: Resigns the window’s key window status.
